snippet: Arizona State’s Curtain of Distraction has taken student-section antics to a new level — and it appears to be costing visiting teams one to two points per game.
abstract: The Upshot; strategy employed by Arizona State University men's basketball fans to distract opponents during free throws, dubbed 'The Curtain,' is as entertaining as it is effective, resulting in additional 1- to 2-point advantage per home game; practice of distracting opposing teams has storied history, but rarely has tactic been as quantifiable and effective as Arizona States's.
lead_paragraph: Arizona State’s Curtain of Distraction has taken student-section antics to a new level — and it appears to be costing visiting teams one to two points per game.

headline.print_headline: Bad Free Throw? Blame the Twerking Livestock
headline.main: How Arizona State Reinvented Free-Throw Distraction
